Functions as Alchemist’s Fire

player/rewards/charm-of-the-dragon-tende.title: Charm of the Dragon-Tender
player/rewards/charm-of-the-dragon-tende.description: Wondrous item, uncommon, requires attunementA small bone-and-vine talisman warm to the touch.Effect Once per long rest, when the warlock deals damage with a spell, they may: gain **temporary hit points equal to 1d6 While attuned, +1 to animal handling of dragonkind and have advantage on initial reaction checks toward the wearer. The charm subtly tightens or loosens with the wearer’s breathing. It smells faintly of ash and clean rain. It grows warm when near dragon eggs or young dragons.

player/rewards/great-reward-the-chaise-l.title: Great Reward - The Chaise Lounger
player/rewards/great-reward-the-chaise-l.description: Sold in the next city for 60G, players split loot 15G each.

player/rules/alignment.html.title: Alignment
player/rules/alignment.html.description: Alignment is a tool to help describe a character’s values and instincts. It is not a straightjacket, and it does not dictate every decision your character makes. People are inconsistent, and characters are allowed to be as well.Alignment should guide how your character tends to act under pressure, not how they behave in every moment.Characters do not need to share the same alignment to work together, but they should be capable of cooperating with the party.

player/rules/hit-point-increases-in-d&d-.title: Hit Point Increases in D&D 5e
player/rules/hit-point-increases-in-d&d-.description:
At 1st level, characters gain the maximum value of their class Hit Die plus their Constitution modifier.At each level after 1st, a character chooses one of the following:
Roll their class Hit Die and add their Constitution modifier
Take the fixed average value of their class Hit Die and add their Constitution modifier
This choice can be made each time you level up. However once you roll the choice is made for that level, it is final, you cannot drop back to the median after the fact. These averages are rounded up, which slightly favors consistency over risk.

headers.heading: Fixed Average Values by Hit Die

player/rules/house-rules.html.title: House Rules
player/rules/house-rules.html.description:
The campaign will start at level 1 for everyone. Everyone uses Point Buy Player Point Buy Worksheet Everyone starts with 27 points. One ability should intentionally be weaker than the others. Full rebuilds are allowed until the start of Session 2. After this it will have to work narratively with DM approval after this. I'm not opposed to character changes but I'd like to avoid destabilizing the party in the process.
Starting Gold and Equipment – D&D Basic RulesShould a new character need to join us in the middle of the campaign, we will most likely start that character at current player character levels unless the narrative and player/dm agree otherwise.This campaign uses standard D&D 5e rules for falling unconscious and death saving throws.Character death is a real possibility. Choices matter, combat can be dangerous, and caution is sometimes the wiser path. Without meaningful consequences, there is no reason to be careful.Resurrection magic exists in the world but follows normal rules. Time limits apply, required spells must be available, and material costs are in line with published rules. Not every death will be easily reversible, and resurrection is never guaranteed to be immediate or convenient.If a character dies, we will handle it respectfully and collaboratively. Options may include resurrection if circumstances allow, introducing a new character, or weaving the loss into the story in a meaningful way.The goal is not to punish players, but to ensure tension, stakes, and emotional weight remain part of the game.Experience will be done through Milestones, I.E. when the DM says you level up... we level your characters up. This will typically be done at the tail end of a session so anyone who needs help doing so may stay after and get the help they need. We will use the optional flanking rules in combat.When two allies are positioned on opposite sides of a creature and both can attack it, they gain advantage on melee attacks against that creature. This applies equally to player characters and enemies.Positioning and movement matter. Enemies will use flanking when it makes sense, just as players can.
When leveling players will have the choice to either take the default HP increase or roll their hit points at the table (Hit Point Increases in D&D 5e), should you roll a 1 you may re-roll once per level.
Choose your Alignment carefully, I'd like to use these as a guide for how your character will react in situations
Racial Bonuses will be used as written in the 5e Players handbook (Racial Ability Score Increases – D&D Basic Rules)We will not be strictly using encumbrance, but I will likely slow you down some if you start carrying around something which is obviously going to slow you down...We will be using the formula (2 x dice) + mod. Will depending on narrative cause a fumble which may, harm you or someone else you didn't intend, drop a weapon... things like this. I won't be breaking weapons etc. on you. The DM may award Inspiration for exceptional role playing, meaningful character driven choices, or moments that strongly reflect a character’s values.Inspiration can be spent to gain advantage on a single roll and does not stack. For most situations, up to two different characters may attempt the same skill check. Alternatively, one character may take the lead while another provides help, granting advantage on the roll.For group checks, everyone involved will roll. The lowest roll is discarded (when 6+ players are rolling), and the majority result will generally determine the outcome, adjusted as needed for the narrative situation.We use standard 5e resting rules. A short rest is at least 1 hour of downtime during which you can spend Hit Dice to regain hit points. A long rest is at least 8 hours of rest including sleep. After a long rest you regain all hit points and some Hit Dice back. You can benefit from only one long rest per 24 hours.
For full details see the official Basic Rules: https://www.dndbeyond.com/sources/dnd/basic-rules-2014/adventuring#Resting

player/sessions/recaps/session-1-recap.h.title: Session 1 Recap
player/sessions/recaps/session-1-recap.h.description: Your investigation into the missing livestock around Edgewood led you far from simple theft or predators.In the woods, you met Sable, a reclusive halfling druid living at the edge of town. She was caring for something unexpected: a small clutch of albino dragons, runts and hatchlings that could not survive elsewhere. What first looked strange quickly revealed itself as fragile and deeply personal.Your search uncovered a darker truth. A hidden group had been using corrupted berryvines to lure and drive malformed dragons south, treating them as mistakes that needed to be erased. When you confronted their leader, Yarnim, the fight took a sudden turn. Rather than fleeing or surrendering, he tried to destroy one of the dragon eggs outright.You stopped him, but not before the egg was badly damaged.Getting the baby dragon back to safety was tense and uncertain. Every movement felt like it mattered. In the end, the hatchling survived.You returned the egg to Sable, informed the town leadership of what was really happening beyond the fields, and returned to Edgewood. The town celebrated quietly. Not everything needed to be said out loud.

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
